item.title: Ed Gein: REAL Life Leatherface
item.description: Ed Gein, a Wisconsin man in the 1950s, committed crimes that would shock the nation. Known for grave robbing and making objects from human remains, Gein’s actions inspired iconic horror characters in films like Psycho and The Texas Chainsaw Massacre. His case revealed the chilling effects of isolation, mental illness, and a twisted upbringing, leaving a lasting mark on true crime history.

media:content.media:title: Ed Gein: REAL Life Leatherface
media:content.media:description: Ed Gein, a Wisconsin man in the 1950s, committed crimes that would shock the nation. Known for grave robbing and making objects from human remains, Gein’s actions inspired iconic horror characters in films like Psycho and The Texas Chainsaw Massacre. His case revealed the chilling effects of isolation, mental illness, and a twisted upbringing, leaving a lasting mark on true crime history.

item.title: He Left a Trail of Horror in His In-Laws’ House While Sleepwalking
item.description: In 1987, Kenneth Parks drove 14 miles, entered his in-laws’ home, and left behind a horrifying scene, all while claiming he was asleep. His defense? Sleepwalking. What followed was one of the most shocking and controversial trials in Canadian history.

item.title: 5-Year-Old VANISHED Without a Trace
item.description: Summer Wells, a 5-year-old girl from Hawkins County, Tennessee, was reported missing on June 15, 2021. Despite extensive search efforts and over 6,500 leads, her whereabouts remain unknown. Authorities continue to investigate, and the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation maintains an active Amber Alert in hopes of bringing Summer home.

item.title: Heavy Metal Band Sacrifices Freshman Elyse Pahler to Make Their Band Famous
item.description: In 1995, 15-year-old Elyse Pahler was killed by three classmates in California. The case drew national attention due to the unusual circumstances and was later solved through police investigation.

item.title: Austin’s Most Disturbing Cold Case Remains Unsolved
item.description: In 1991, four teenage girls were killed in a yogurt shop in Austin, Texas. Decades later, DNA and investigative work have identified a likely suspect, offering new insight into this long-unsolved case

item.title: Family Hike Turns Fatal in Devil's Den
item.description: Clinton Brink, 43, and Cristen Brink, 41, were fatally attacked while hiking with their two daughters, ages 7 and 9, in Devil’s Den State Park, Arkansas. The children were unharmed. Arrests have been made and authorities are still investigating what led to this tragic event.

item.title: She Was Missing For Four Years Before She Showed Up!
item.description: Alicia Navarro vanished from her Arizona home in 2019 at age 14. In 2023, she unexpectedly walked into a Montana police station, sparking questions about where she had been and what happened during her time away.

item.title: “Uncle John” Hid Horrifying Secrets and an Internet Persona to Hunt Women
item.description: “Uncle John” Hid Horrifying Secrets and an Internet Persona to Hunt Women

item.title: The Unexplained Absence That Shattered a Family
item.description: Lindsay Clancy, a Massachusetts nurse and mother, was arrested for the deaths of her three young children in January 2023. She has pleaded not guilty and her defense aims to claim she was not criminally responsible due to a severe mental health condition.

item.title: He Ended His Parents' Life Over a Date and Started a New Life
item.description: He Ended His Parents' Life Over a Date and Started a New Life

item.title: From 'That '70s Show' to a 30-Year Sentence: Danny Masterson's Legal Battle
item.description: Danny Masterson, former actor on That '70s Show, was sentenced to 30 years in prison in 2023 after convictions on multiple felony charges; his case included appeals and retrials before the final sentence.

item.title: From Absence to Enigma: Thabo Bester's Puzzling Comeback Story
item.description: Thabo Bester, who previously served time for serious crimes, faked his death in 2022 to escape prison. He was apprehended in Tanzania in 2023 and returned to South Africa, facing multiple legal charges. His case attracted international attention and inspired the Netflix docuseries Beauty and the Bester.

item.title: The Shocking Story of a Mom Who Cyberbullied Her Daughter For YEARS!
item.description: A mother, Licari, reportedly harassed her daughter online over several years. The case drew attention for its long-term emotional impact and prompted discussions on parental responsibility and online safety.

item.title: Could NYPD Detective's Daughter's Cold Case Be Solved After 20 Years?
item.description: Megan McDonald, 20, was found dead in 2003 in Wallkill, New York. Her ex-boyfriend Edward Holley was arrested in 2023, but a mistrial was declared in 2025. A retrial is expected.

item.title: Iryna Zarutska's New Beginning in the US Turned Into a Fatal Nightmare
item.description: Ukrainian refugee Iryna Zarutska was fatally stabbed on a Charlotte light rail train. Decarlos Brown Jr. has been federally charged, and authorities are reviewing transit safety measures.

item.title: A Missing Boy, A Mother's Lies, and a 30-Year Wait for Justice
item.description: Michelle Lodzinski’s 6-year-old son, Jeremy, vanished in 1988. After decades of investigation, she was convicted in 2021 for his murder, ending a 30-year search for justice.

item.title: Legendary Sheriff Who Inspired Hollywood Now Suspected of the Unthinkable
item.description: Legendary Sheriff Who Inspired Hollywood Now Suspected of the Unthinkable

item.title: He Targeted Both Men And Women
item.description: Israel Keyes was a serial killer known for targeting both men and women across the United States. He carefully planned his crimes, often hiding “kill kits” in different states years in advance. His chilling methods and ability to move undetected made him one of the most elusive criminals of his time.

item.title: Clues Behind Chandra Levy's Mysterious End
item.description: n May 2001, 24-year-old Chandra Levy, a federal intern, disappeared in Washington, D.C. Her remains were found in Rock Creek Park in 2002. Ingmar Guandique was convicted in 2010, but the conviction was overturned in 2016 due to issues with the prosecution's case. The murder remains unsolved, and the case continues to intrigue and puzzle investigators and the public.

item.title: The Case of Baby Emmanuel Haro Is Darker Than Anyone Knew
item.description: In August 2025, 7-month-old Emmanuel Haro was reported missing in Yucaipa, California. His parents, Jake and Rebecca Haro, initially claimed he was abducted. Upon investigation, authorities found inconsistencies in their statements. The Haros were arrested and charged with murder, with prosecutors alleging prolonged abuse led to Emmanuel's death.
